qas.question: What two people are responsible for the first still in existence book in the Estonian Language?
In what year was S. Wanradt and J. Koell's book written?
What type of book was it?

answers.text: bilingual German-Estonian translation of the Lutheran catechism

qas.question: What book specifically for the use of priests was printed in Estonian?
What year was the priests' grammar book put into print?
Who wrote the last Estonian book?
What book was published in Eastern Estonia in 1715?
What book was not used by priests in 1637?
Who wrote the grammar book in 1637?

context: The first extant Estonian book is a <a2_0>bilingual German-Estonian translation of the Lutheran catechism<a2_0/> by <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>S. Wanradt and J. Koell<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> dating to <a1_0>1535<a1_0/>, during the Protestant Reformation period. <a3_0>An <b7_0>Estonian grammar book<b7_0/><a3_0/> to be used by priests was printed in German in <a4_0>1637<a4_0/>. <b6_0>The New Testament<b6_0/> was translated into southern Estonian in 1686 (northern Estonian, 1715). The two languages were united based on northern Estonian by <b8_0>Anton thor Helle.
